page.title: 08RHUM SHEARWATERS RESEARCH
page.content: Shearwaters are the subject of a three year study which aims to investigate mortality & factors affecting breeding outcome.Burrows are being monitored to assess the influence of their physical characteristics on breeding success. Preliminary results indicate drainage is important; poorly_sited burrows are at risk of flooding following heavy rain.Food samples collected from adult birds throughout the breeding season, together with weighing of feeds given to chicks,provide info.on influence of feeding ecology on breeding outcome. Potential predators include golden eagles, white_tailed sea eagles, great black_backed gulls, brown rats & even red deer! Meal remains left by avian predators provide info.on their impact while trapping & observation indicate rats scavenge abandoned eggs & dead chicks but are not predators.
